definition: banner/flag/(in Qing times) Manchu (cf. 八旗[Ba1 qi2])/administrative subdivision in inner Mongolia equivalent to 縣|县[xian4] county/CL:面[mian4]

sentences.english: Listen to the interview with Mr. Malcolm Lang Land and answer the following questions.
sentences.chinese: 听下面的对马克姆朗兰德的彩旗，回答下列问题。

sentences.english: The hall was bedecked with flags and flowers for the wedding ceremony.
sentences.chinese: 为了这次婚礼，大厅用彩旗和花装饰起来了。
其他学校也一口许诺会有“彩旗飘飘”。

sentences.english: The colour flags snuffled against the wind.
sentences.chinese: 彩旗迎风飘摆呼呼作响。

sentences.english: Colorful flags danced in the breeze.
There was an air of amusement as they approached the playground, which was afraid with banderole and balloons.
sentences.chinese: 赶往挂满了彩旗和气球的操场时，有一种节日的气氛。

sentences.english: A film festival; a high-school music festival .
sentences.chinese: 为庆祝音乐节，街道上挂满了彩旗。

sentences.english: The street is decorated with bunting for the music festival.
sentences.chinese: 为庆祝音乐节，街道上挂满了彩旗。

sentences.english: The square was bedecked with flags and flowers.
sentences.chinese: 广场挂满了各色彩旗和摆满了鲜花。

sentences.english: The city's main streets were decked with multi-coloured banners.
sentences.chinese: 市区的主要街道装饰着各种颜色的彩旗。

sentences.english: Coloured flags were flapping in the wind.
This draws a waving colored flag, that undulates its way around the screen.
sentences.chinese: 绘制一面飘展的彩旗，在屏幕上四处飘动。

definition: to be decorated with lanterns and colored banners (idiom)
